meanings.definition: A person who brings a lawsuit or accuses another in court.
meanings.sent1: The libellant accused the defendant of stealing his idea.
meanings.sent2: The libellant filed a lawsuit against the company for wrongful termination.
meanings.sent3: The libellant walked confidently into the courtroom, ready to seek justice.
meanings.sent4: She was a fierce libellant, fighting for what she believed was right.
meanings.sent5: The determined libellant stood tall, determined to win the case.

meanings.definition: The party who brings a libel suit.
meanings.sent1: The libellant in this case is seeking damages for the false accusations made against them.
meanings.sent2: The libellant presented strong evidence to support their libel suit.
meanings.sent3: The libellant's lawyer made a clever argument in court, defending their reputation.
meanings.sent4: As the libellant, she felt the weight of proving the truth behind the accusations.
meanings.sent5: The libellant's determination to clear their name was evident to all in the courtroom.
